Reviews.Title: If your poor and this is all you can afford - maybe then....
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: To preface my opinion -- I bought this for strictly development Android work, and it is only $68...BUT, if you are expecting a decent tablet to use in your everyday life, I would say stay away!  Windows 8 didn't even recognize this device and I had to download some unsigned drivers to even get the my development machine to "talk" with it...As you can tell, I  do software development for a living and have worked with MANY mobile devices on all 3 platforms (Apple, Microsoft and Android), and this one is pretty bad.  The screen colors are very dim (relative to an iPhone), the battery life is about an hour if you are doing anything intensive, and if you where to drop it, it would probably break into a 1,000 pieces.  Lastly, the web surfing is very slow.It did run the games my kids wanted to try, like Fruit Ninja, but again, you could tell the processor was struggling.All in all, you get what you pay for... This works for what I need in the short term, which is just a device to test out my prototypes...Again, it is only $68, so I wasn't expected too much, but I was still surprised with what I got (in a bad way)... If I was going to use this everyday I would send this back and would spend the extra $$$ to get a decent performing tablet.  Though, in my world of development, we try to work with the minimum possible to try and cover all basis, so it works for me...To wrap up, if you want something you will be using everyday, don't get this tablet and spend the extra money to get something decent and from a known manufacturer...Just my opinion...

Reviews.Title: Great Android tablet for most uses
Reviews.Author: Fiona
Reviews.Content: I got this for my 8 yr old daughter so she could watch youtube and play without taking the computer.  So far, it has been great - it took a little while to get it set up with the apps she wanted, but now she is so happy with it.  Obviously it is not as fast as my kindle fire, but it is a great option for what she wants.  It came quickly and already had the google play store installed and I was also able to put on the amazon app store, so she can get access to just about any app she wants.  The battery life is not too good, but again for the price it was a great deal.  If you are getting it, just remember to be patient with setup, she tried to install 6 apps all at once and it was too much for this tablet to handle, but when I went back and did one at a time for her, it went very smoothly.A bonus, it fits the older generic case I had bought for my kindle fire, so until we get out for her to choose her own case, it is protected, which is better for my peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: GREAT tablet for the money!
Reviews.Author: Zak "Diva"
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for my four year old brother because he loves to play the games on an older android phone we had given him. I was able to get a screen protector, keyboard case, and an adapter, four styluses, and the tablet for all under 90 dollars. The tablet is blue as the seller I had picked stated it was blue. It came with Android 4.1.1 Jellybean. When I first turned it on I was kinda disappointed that it was a bit slower then I was expecting but I had fixed that by downloading Nova Prime Launcher which allowed me to change the home layout, hide apps, etc. I put a 32GB SD Card in the tablet to put the games on the SD card to save memory which also helped a lot. I downloaded a task killer and taught him how to use it to save battery life. I know it states this tablet has about 5 hours of battery life well that's a total lie. It's got about 2 hours, but for the price and how fast it charges back up It doesn't bother us. Its got a one year warranty which is another reason why it's a great buy. I would recommend this to anyone who's looking for a great deal and a fast tablet! Also If you're wondering the seller I had bought from is Andteck USA (They're amazing and offer you tech help after you buy probably one of the best sellers on Amazon!) If you have any questions feel free to ask!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful, responsive screen. Speaker volume sucks
Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: Well I just got this tablet today. I got this for my mom and for the most part is a nice tablet. Screen is nice, way nicer than I expected. Its responsive to the touch but the machine is a little slow...but this is a cheap tablet so no surprise. Plus I have been spoiled by faster computers. It seems to charge fast and the battery life really isn't to great. probably just get a couple hours. You can still use it if its plugged in and charging if you must. My major complaint is the speaker volume its barely audible. It may be ok if you are in a very quiet place or use decent earbuds but not good to set on a table closeby and listen to Pandora or anything. I may return over the sound volume thing not sure yet. It was disappointing. I will update later if anything arises and feel the need. All in all for $60 for a cheap portable little web browsing Facebook machine its ok.

Reviews.Title: dark screen and problematic
Reviews.Author: Lawman
Reviews.Content: First, this was the cheapest 7" I could find at the time, $68.  I am comparing it to my $199 Kindle Fire.  Perhaps not a fair comparison, I get that.  Out of the box it is much lighter and has a feeling of cheapness compared to KF.  The power cord does not insert all the way, which seems like a malfunction, but it does work.  The battery is much less adequate, running down in less than two hours compared to over 4 for the KF. The display screen is very dark and not able to be lightened sufficiently to be what I consider adequate.  KF is brilliant in this category.  Frequently it misbehaves and needs a total reboot to get it to work at all.  About every other day with this problem.Positives:  It works.  For one third the price of KF you can get a working tablet.  It has Google Play, which means my 8 year old can download and play all the games that Amazon won't let us get on Kindles.  It has a front facing camera (KF does not) so presumably Skype should work, tho I did not test that.  It gets gmail without issue and it can browse the web adequately.Bottom line--After seeing the great display on KF, I would never be satisfied with this.  But I will keep it for my daughter, and she loves it.  If you are an adult and can afford better, buy better.

Reviews.Title: READ BEFORE PURCHASING
Reviews.Author: Brandon Probst
Reviews.Content: This tablet comes with the Korean version of Android, which isn't immediately apparent since everything's in English. Why does it matter, then? Because as soon as you log into Google account, you're now Korean, with no access to the North American (or wherever you are) Play Store. I did a factory reset on my North American phone, as well as the tablet about a dozen times, and even had a 45 minute phone call with Google support, and an email exchange with Google engineers, because this is apparently a glitch in Google - it now thinks you're in both countries, but errs on the side of Korea, so you're pretty much locked out from any content.As far as the tablet itself, it's pretty slow, the low resolution looks way worse than you expect it to on a 7-inch screen, the battery has about two hours of life in it (that's after being fully charged, with a fresh install of android, nothing running) and it needs to be at the right angle for the screen to be visible and not distorted. Basically, I'm advising against it.

Reviews.Author: HolyCow
Reviews.Content: The android works great.  It is sleek in design and seems to be pretty durable.  It is easy to navigate.  The instruction booklet that comes with it is not detailed and of little use.  The system is easy enough to figure out just by working through the various apps already installed. The battery life is disappointing, it dies after less than one hour of use.  However, the battery recharges in less than one hour.  We purchased the android to use solely for checking email while traveling.  It works great for that purpose.  The size is what appeals to me, It can be stowed in a small spot in a carryon bag. There is no identifiable name anywhere on or in the android, and no warranty information was provided wit the android, so good luck if it dies.

ProductInfo.Features:
This Alldaymall tablet use fast 1.5GHz Allwinner A23 Dual Core CPU, which has high performance and low power consumption.
Google Play Pre-Installed, which gives you access to thousands of free apps isntantly.The tablet supports Skype Video Calling, Netflix, Facebook, YouTube and more.
The built-in Wi-Fi in this tablet supports Wi-Fi 802.11b/g/n to make it easy for users to connect online, downloads or surf the web with advanced Wi-Fi technology.
It is 4 GB of built-in storage, but you're free to expand that storage capability by up to 32 GB TF card. Simply slide an TF card in and enjoy photo slideshows, music playback, and even video playback!
Supported and fully warrantied by Alldaymall!
ProductInfo.Name: Alldaymall® 7 Inch Android 4.2 Tablet PC MID with Capacitive Touchscreen (Dual Core CPU, 1.5GHz, Wi-Fi, Dual Camera) Black
